meanings.definition: The process of making something conform to a standard.
meanings.sent1: The standardization of the test ensured everyone had an equal chance to succeed.
meanings.sent2: The company implemented standardization in their production line to improve efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The standardization of the cookie sizes made for some very uniform snacks.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to standardization was like a well-oiled machine, ensuring everything ran smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The standardization of the uniforms made the team look incredibly professional.

meanings.definition: The act of establishing a standard for something.
meanings.sent1: The standardization of safety protocols was crucial for the well-being of the employees.
meanings.sent2: The standardization of measurements made it easier for everyone to follow the recipe.
meanings.sent3: The standardization of the rules brought a sense of order to the chaotic situation.
meanings.sent4: His commitment to standardization set a benchmark for excellence in the industry.
meanings.sent5: The standardization of the language allowed for better communication among different regions.

meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being standardized.
meanings.sent1: The standardization of the product ensured consistent quality across all batches.
meanings.sent2: The standardization of the software led to fewer compatibility issues.
meanings.sent3: The standardization of the colors made the room look very harmonious.
meanings.sent4: The standardization of the procedures streamlined the entire process.
meanings.sent5: The standardization of the materials improved the overall durability of the product.
